title: Determining Involvement of Two-Way Tables

choices.text: Bivariate (two-variable) data with an explanatory/response relationship.

solution:
Two-way tables, by definition, deal with categorical values.

Explanation of Distractors

Choice 'A' is incorrect; two-way tables deal with categorical variables, not quantitative.

Choice 'C' is incorrect; one *could *make a two-way table from two independent samples if they were categorical, but not if the samples are quantitative.

Choice 'D' is incorrect; linear regression T
procedures would be used for bivariate data with an explanatory/response relationship.

Choice 'E' is incorrect; a single sample could be made into a two-way table, but only if two categorical variables are involved.
